Package chess

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Elijah Ongoco + Brian Albert This class is for a Board object, which has two fields: turn (String) and board (Piece[][]) turn will always either have "white" or "black" signifying whose turn it is to move. board is an 8x8 matrix, where each index is a space on the board. The Piece object is detailed in the pieces package.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Initializes a Board object, with the default starting player as "white", and it fills up the 8x8 board with a standard starting chess layout.

      deepClone returns a deep clone of the board

      Checks whether or not the current state of the board is in check for the specified king.
      static boolean inCheckmate​(char side, Piece[][] board)
      Checks whether or not the current state of the board is in checkmate, provided it is already in check.

      Takes an index in a 2D array and returns what the rank and file for that index would be given our implementation of the chess board.
      void printBoard()
      Prints the board in the terminal after every move.

      Takes a String designating a rank/file for a piece and returns what the coordinates in our matrix would be.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Initializes a Board object, with the default starting player as "white", and it fills up the 8x8 board with a standard starting chess layout. White will be on the bottom part of the board, black will be on top.

    • Method Detail

      • indexToRankFile

        public static java.lang.String indexToRankFile​(int row,
                                               int column)
        Takes an index in a 2D array and returns what the rank and file for that index would be given our implementation of the chess board.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the index
        column - The column of the index
        Returns:
        The file/rank designation. For example, board[6][4] would return "e2".

      • rankFileToIndex

        public static int[] rankFileToIndex​(java.lang.String fileRank)
        Takes a String designating a rank/file for a piece and returns what the coordinates in our matrix would be.
        Parameters:
        fileRank - The string designation of file/rank, for example, "e2".
        Returns:
        A set of coordinates where [0] would be the row, and [1] would be the column. For example, "e2" would return [6, 4]

      • inCheck

        public static boolean inCheck​(char side,
                              Piece[][] board)
        Checks whether or not the current state of the board is in check for the specified king.
        Parameters:
        board - The board to be assessed.
        side - 'b' for checking if black is in check, 'w' for checking if white is in check.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if the current state of the board is in check or not.

      • inCheckmate

        public static boolean inCheckmate​(char side,
                                  Piece[][] board)
        Checks whether or not the current state of the board is in checkmate, provided it is already in check.
        Parameters:
        side - For which side the checkmate may be against
        board - The board state of which to check
        Returns:
        True if it is checkmate, false if it is not

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the board in the terminal after every move. Done on an existing board object, on its Piece[][] field.

      • deepClone

        public static Piece[][] deepClone​(Piece[][] toClone)
        deepClone returns a deep clone of the board
        Parameters:
        toClone - the board to be cloned
        Returns:
        the new cloned board
